Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish living in a water environment such as a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can label the parts of the water environment, such as water and plants found there.
The student can show other living things that might be in the fish's habitat, like plants, other water animals, or humans.
The student can label the resources the fish needs from its environment, such as water to swim in and food to eat.
The student can illustrate how the fish and its environment work together as part of a system, highlighting how each part helps the fish meet its needs.
